tags.name: orders
tags.description: Operations related to ordering and orders.

get.description: Retrieves the account balance. Returns the balance in a specified currency if the currency parameter is provided. If not, returns all balances greater than 0.

oneOf.title: Single balance
oneOf.description: If the `currency` parameter is provided, the response will be a single balance object.

oneOf.title: Multiple balances
oneOf.description: If the `currency` parameter is omitted, the response will be an array of balance objects.

get.description: Get a list of all of your orders.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number (1–500) of orders to include in each page of orders. Default: 100.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A cursor. Using this parameter will return the page of orders from *before* the cursor (i.e., the _previous_ page). The `before` and `after` cursors are mutually exclusive (you can't use them at the same time). Get this value from the `pagination` section of any page of orders.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A cursor. Using this parameter will return the page of orders from *after* the cursor (i.e., the _next_ page). The `before` and `after` cursors are mutually exclusive (you can't use them at the same time). Get this value from the `pagination` section of any page of orders.

items.title: Items
items.description: The list of orders in the page.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: A unique string that prevents order duplication. See [Idempotency](/best-practices/idempotency) for more information.

parameters.name: X-Execution-Mode
parameters.description: Whether to process the order synchronously or asynchronously. If this header is omitted we default to async. See [which mode to use](/getting-started/first-order/which-mode) to help you decide which execution mode is right for your use case. Sync orders are limited to a single order item.

200.description: Response that will be returned in sync execution mode. Order has successfully been completed.

202.description: Response that will be returned in async execution mode. Order has successfully been accepted.

requestBody.description: The details of the order to create.

get.description: Get the details and status of a specific order. Can be used for checking the status of an async order after it's been accepted.

requestBody.description: The details of the order to estimate.

get.description: List all products in your catalog

parameters.name: is_orderable
parameters.description: Filter by products which can be ordered. If `true`, returns only those which can be ordered, if `false`, returns all products.

parameters.name: countries_redeemable_in
parameters.description: Filter by countries where a product can be redeemed in. To specify multiple countries repeat the parameter for each country, e.g. `?countries_redeemable_in=US&countries_redeemable_in=GB`

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Filter by product categories. To specify multiple categories repeat the parameter for each category, e.g. `?categories=fashion&categories=department-stores`. You can pull the list of categories [list categories](/reference/2024-02-05/endpoint/products/categories) endpoint.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination to return the next set of products. The before and after cursors are mutually exclusive (you can't use them at the same time).

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination to return the previous set of products. The before and after cursors are mutually exclusive (you can't use them at the same time).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of items to be returned.

200.description: List of products in your catalog

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Defines the format for product content resources. It accepts 'url' (default), 'md', or 'html' to return URLs, raw Markdown, or HTML content, respectively.

get.description: Retrieves a list of countries where products are available

200.description: A list of countries where products are available

get.summary: Retrieves a list of product categories

200.description: A list of all possible product categories

requestBody.description: Sent when an order finishes processing, the body object will be one of the following schemas depending on the order status.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully
Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

X-Api-Version.name: X-Api-Version
X-Api-Version.description: The dated version of the API, if not specified a default is used. See [API versioning](/best-practices/api-versioning) for more information.

CurrencyForAccount.name: currency
CurrencyForAccount.description: The currency of the account, represented by ISO 4217 currency codes. Check the [currencies](/reference/currency) for a listing of supported currencies.

message.title: Message
message.description: A human readable summary of the error.
message.example: The requested resource was not found

help.title: Help
help.description: Additional information that pertains to the error.
help.example: Please check the resource ID and try again.

OrderDescription.title: Description
OrderDescription.description: Free format text reference for the order. Not visible to the end user. Will be visible to you in the Runa web portal.

CurrencyForAccount.description: The currency of the account, represented by ISO 4217 currency codes. Check the [currencies](/reference/currency) for a listing of supported currencies.

id.title: ID
id.description: The ID of the order item.

distribution_method.title: Distribution Method
distribution_method.description: The distribution method used for the payout link.

products.title: Products
products.description: The product(s) the end user can redeem the payout link on.

face_value.title: Face Value
face_value.description: The face value of the payout link.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price paid for the payout link.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the payout link, represented by ISO 4217 currency codes.

CompletedOrderWithBasicDetails.title: Completed order
CompletedOrderWithBasicDetails.description:
Used for orders that have completed. This class is typically used when returning
a *list* of orders to the client.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: UTC timestamp, in ISO 8601 format, when the order was submitted.

completed_at.title: Completed At
completed_at.description: UTC timestamp, in ISO 8601 format, when the order was completed.

payment_method.title: Payment Method
payment_method.description: The payment method used for the order.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the order, represented by ISO 4217 currency codes. Please check the currency section in the guidelines for how to use this field.

total_price.title: Total Price
total_price.description: The total price of the order. This _includes_ any applicable fees.

total_discount.title: Total Discount
total_discount.description: The total discount of the order.

CompletedOrderWebhook.title: Completed order
CompletedOrderWebhook.description: Webhook message sent when an order has completed processing.

FailedOrderWebhook.title: Failed order
FailedOrderWebhook.description: Webhook message sent when an order has failed to process.

error.title: Error
error.description: A human readable error message describing the error.

CompletedOrderWithFullDetails.title: Completed order
CompletedOrderWithFullDetails.description:
Used for an order that has completed. This class is typically used when returning
a *single order* to the client.

items.title: Items
items.description: The list of items that were included in the order. Each _item_ represents a single payout link.

EmailDistribution.title: Email

email_address.title: Email Address
email_address.description: The email address of the end user to send the payout link to.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The template ID for a User Redemption Template.

EmailDistribution.description: Email distribution. Send the payout link to the end user directly via email.

IncompleteOrder.title: Incomplete order

message.title: Message
message.description: Human readable message describing the status of the order.

IncompleteOrder.description: Order that has been accepted but is not complete.

LinkDistribution.title: Link

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The template ID for a User Redemption Template.

LinkDistribution.description: Link distribution. Send the payout link to the end user yourself.

MultipleProduct.title: Multiple

values.title: Values
values.description: The codes for the products the end user can choose from when redeeming their payout link. All products _must_ use the same currency.

MultipleProduct.description:
Multiple products. The end user will be able to split the payout link's value
between these products.

MultipleProductType.title: MultipleProductType
MultipleProductType.description: Multiple products. When more than one product code is provided.

PayoutSelectionTemplate.title: Template

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The template ID for a Payout Selection Template.

PayoutSelectionTemplate.description: Payout selection template. Template having predefined set of products.

PayoutSelectionTemplateDetailed.title: PayoutSelectionTemplateDetailed

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The template ID for a Payout Selection Template.

values.title: Values
values.description: The codes for products selected for Payout Selection Template.

PayoutSelectionTemplateDetailed.description: Payout selection template. Template having predefined set of products.

payment_method.title: Payment Method
payment_method.description: Payment method for the order. Select the `ACCOUNT_BALANCE` you want to pay for the order from

items.title: Items
items.description: The list of items to be included in the order. Each item ordered results in a single payout link. The maximum number of items per order is 200.

face_value.title: Face Value
face_value.description: Face value of the payout link. The currency of the face value is inferred from the product selection.

distribution_method.title: Distribution Method
distribution_method.description: Distribution method to send end users the payout link. Choose `EMAIL` if you want Runa to send the payout link to the end user directly. Choose `PAYOUT_LINK` if you want to send the payout link to the end user yourself.

products.title: Products
products.description: Choose `SINGLE` if you want the end user to redeem the face value on a single specific product. Choose `MULTIPLE` if the end user can choose to spend the face value across multiple products.

OrderItemDiscount.title: OrderItemDiscount

products.title: Products
products.description: Choose `SINGLE` if you want the end user to redeem the face value on a single specific product. Choose `MULTIPLE` if the end user can choose to spend the face value across multiple products.

face_value.title: Face Value
face_value.description: Face value of the reward link.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price of the order item.

discount_multiplier.title: Discount Multiplier
discount_multiplier.description: The discount multiplier of the order item. 0 means no discount and 0.1 means 10% discount. The discount is applied on the price of the order item before any fees are applied.

OrderItemDiscount.description: The computed discount for an order item.

OrderItemPriceRequest.title: OrderItemPriceRequest

products.title: Products
products.description: Choose `SINGLE` if you want the end user to redeem the face value on a single specific product. Choose `MULTIPLE` if the end user can choose to spend the face value across multiple products.

face_value.title: Face Value
face_value.description: Face value of the reward link.

OrderItemPriceRequest.description: A proposed order item within an order price request.

OrderPriceRequest.title: OrderPriceRequest

payment_method.title: Payment Method
payment_method.description: Payment method for the order. Select the `ACCOUNT_BALANCE` you want to pay for the order from.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of order items for price estimation.

OrderPriceRequest.description: Request for a price estimate for an order.

OrderPriceResponse.title: OrderPriceResponse

items.title: Items
items.description: List of order items with price and discount.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the order, represented by ISO 4217 currency codes. Please check the currency section in the guidelines for how to use this field.

total_discount.title: Total Discount
total_discount.description: Total discount on the entire order.

total_price.title: Total Price
total_price.description: Total price of the entire order.

OrderPriceResponse.description: Response object for a order price estimate.

TransactionDetail.title: TransactionDetail
TransactionDetail.description: A mapping of the subtotal of the order using the payout currency as a key.

TransactionDetailEntry.title: TransactionDetailEntry
TransactionDetailEntry.description: A subtotal of the value purchased and associated fees and data about the transaction.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value purchased of a payout link currency.

TransactionDetailFXDetails.title: TransactionDetailFxDetails
TransactionDetailFXDetails.description: Provides details on fx conversion for an order transaction detail. Present when the payment method currency is different from the transaction detail currency.

rate.title: FX Rate
rate.description: The FX rate received for the transaction between the payout currency and payment currency.

rate_symbol.title: FX Rate symbol
rate_symbol.description: The currency pair associated with the FX transaction.

fee.title: Fee
fee.description: The fee charged for making this transaction.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: How many records the current page is limited to.

after.title: After
after.description: Cursor to query the next page.

before.title: Before
before.description: Cursor to query the previous page.

SingleProduct.title: Single

value.title: Value
value.description: The code for the product the end user will get when redeeming their payout link.

SingleProduct.description:
Single product. The end user will be able to redeem the payout link for this
specific product.

SingleProductType.title: SingleProductType
SingleProductType.description: Single product. When only one product code is provided.

UnknownProduct.title: UnknownProduct

type.title: Type
type.description: It is not currently possible to determine which products were selected when this item was ordered.

UnknownProduct.description:
Product(s) unknown. It was not possible to determine which products were included
in the order.

product_code.description: The code of the product that was updated.

old_state.description: The state of the product before the update.

new_state.description: The state of the product after the update.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp, in ISO 8601 format, when the product was updated.

ProductUpdateState.title: Product update state
ProductUpdateState.description: The state of the product either before or after the update.

PayoutStatus.title: Payout status
PayoutStatus.description: Current status of the payout link. An `ACTIVE` link is live but has not been claimed yet, it will change to `CLAIMED` once that has happened. If you request a cancellation the status will reflect this as `CANCELLED`. Finally if your account is configured with expiry, when a link expires it will be marked as `EXPIRED`.

status_updated_at.title: Status Updated At
status_updated_at.description: Time that the payout link status was last updated

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL (payout link) the end user uses to redeem.

expiry_date.title: Expiry Date
expiry_date.description: The date that the payout link expires.

ValidationErrorItem.title: ValidationErrorItem

message.title: Message
message.description: A human readable summary of the error.
message.example: ensure this value is greater than or equal to 1

location.title: Location
location.description: The location of the error in the submitted entity.

ValidationErrorItem.description: A single validation error. The type indicates the error type and the message provides a human readable summary of the error. The location provides a path to the key in the request body.

ValidationErrorResponse.title: ValidationErrorResponse

message.title: Message
message.description: A human readable summary of the error.
message.example: There were one or more problems processing your request, see details key.

help.title: Help
help.description: Additional information that pertains to the error.

ValidationErrorResponse.description: A validation error response. Returned when the request failed validation. This response can contain multiple validation errors, see the details key for each.

balance_check_url.description: URL to check the gift card balance.

redeemable_at.description: Defines where the gift card can be redeemed. Options are 'all' for both online and in-store, 'in-store' for in-store only, and 'online' for online only.

barcode_format.description: The barcode format of the product.

e_code_usage_type.description: The e-code usage type of the product.

description_markdown_url.description: A URL pointing to a markdown file that contains the description of the resource.

disclaimer_markdown_url.description: A URL pointing to a markdown file that contains the disclaimer information.

refund_policy_markdown_url.description: A URL pointing to a markdown file that outlines the refund policy, if applicable.

reissuance_policy_markdown_url.description: A URL pointing to a markdown file that details the reissuance policy for the resource.

terms_buyer_markdown_url.description: A URL pointing to a markdown file that contains the terms and conditions applicable to buyers.

terms_consumer_markdown_url.description: A URL pointing to a markdown file that contains the terms and conditions applicable to consumers.

redemption_instructions_markdown_url.description: A URL pointing to a markdown file that provides instructions for redeeming the resource.

locale.description: ISO2 format locale code. It denotes what locale the markdown urls are.

description_md.description: Markdown content for the resource description.

disclaimer_md.description: Markdown content for the disclaimer information.

refund_policy_md.description: Markdown content outlining the refund policy, if applicable.

reissuance_policy_md.description: Markdown content detailing the reissuance policy for the resource.

terms_buyer_md.description: Markdown content containing terms and conditions applicable to buyers.

terms_consumer_md.description: Markdown content containing terms and conditions applicable to consumers.

redemption_instructions_md.description: Markdown instructions for redeeming the resource.

locale.description: Locale code for the markdown content, in ISO2 format.

description_html.description: HTML content for the resource description.

disclaimer_html.description: HTML content for the disclaimer information.

refund_policy_html.description: HTML content outlining the refund policy, if applicable.

reissuance_policy_html.description: HTML content detailing the reissuance policy for the resource.

terms_buyer_html.description: HTML content containing terms and conditions applicable to buyers.

terms_consumer_html.description: HTML content containing terms and conditions applicable to consumers.

redemption_instructions_html.description: HTML instructions for redeeming the resource.

locale.description: Locale code for the HTML content, in ISO2 format.

CustomerService.description: Contact information for customer service related to the product.

Denominations.description: Defines the denomination options available for the product, including ranges and types.

available_list.description: A list of available denominations for the product. Null if `type` is `OPEN`.

maximum_value.description: The maximum denomination value available for the product.

minimum_value.description: The minimum denomination value available for the product.

type.description: The type of denomination. Can be open or fixed. Open is Any amount between min and max value. Fixed is limited to those returned in the available_list.

in_months.description: Specifies the number of months until the gift expires.

x-enumDescriptions.from-last-use: The expiration period starts after the gift is used for a purchase.
x-enumDescriptions.from-last-balance-check: The expiration period starts after the gift balance is checked using phone or online tools.
x-enumDescriptions.from-issue-date: The expiration period starts from the date the gift was purchased.
x-enumDescriptions.indefinite: The gift card does not expire and remains valid indefinitely.

length_unit.description: The unit of time for the subscription plan. Currently only DAYS and MONTHS are supported.

subscription_plan_code.description: Use this code during order creation, rather than the top level code that is part of Product.

Product.description: Base schema for all product types, containing common fields.

approval_state.description: Indicates weather product should be enabled for a customer based on customer supplied data. Currently only returning `APPROVED` products.

categories.description: List of the categories that the product belongs to. You can fetch the list of categories using the [`GET /product/categories` endpoint](/reference/2024-02-05/endpoint/products/categories).

code.description: A unique code identifying the product. You can filter for a specific product using this code, or use it for order creation - see SubscriptionPlan for more details on ordering subscription products.

countries_redeemable_in.description: Countries where the payout can be spent.

currency.description: The currency of the product, represented by ISO 4217 currency codes. Please check the currency section in the guidelines for how to use this field.

discount_multiplier.description: A multiplier used to calculate the price of your order.

state.description: The current state of the product.

is_orderable.description: Indicates whether or not you are able to order the product. You should use this detail to determine whether or not to display the product to your end users.

payout_type.description: The type of payout - this field will tell you the key of the additional object details that correspond to each payout type. It can be either `gift_card`, `subscription`, or `payment` for now, however, it will be extended to more types in the future, your implementation should account for it. Please check the Payout Type section in the guidelines for how to use this field.

availability.description: The availability type of the product.

maximum_value.description: The maximum denomination value available for the product.

minimum_value.description: The minimum denomination value available for the product.

ApiKeyAuth.name: X-Api-Key
ApiKeyAuth.description: Your API key. See the [API key](/getting-started/api-key) page on details of how to generate and store your keys.
